news.title: S$200 000 Presidential Revolving Fund launched in Glen View South
news.content:
Herald Reporter

In a significant move to bolster economic development, a US$200 000 Presidential Revolving Fund has been launched in Glen View South, Harare.

This initiative aims to empower local residents by providing interest-free loans for entrepreneurial projects, thereby fostering self-sufficiency and community growth.

The fund is part of a broader national strategy to stimulate grassroots economic activities.

Addressing Glen View South Constituency, Dr Paul Tungwarara, Special Advisor to the President, emphasised the importance of discipline and accountability among beneficiaries to ensure the funds sustainability.

Responsible borrowing and timely repayment will ensure that more people benefit from this initiative, thereby driving long-term economic progress in our communities, he said.

Community members have welcomed the fund, viewing it as an opportunity to start and expand their small businesses.

One resident, Tendai Chuma said, This fund gives us hope. Many of us have business ideas but lack capital. Now we have a chance to grow.

The revolving fund is expected to create hundreds of jobs and uplift the livelihoods of Glen View South residents.

Similar initiatives are being implemented across the country, including the US$1,5 million Presidential War Veterans Fund, with each of Zimbabwes 10 provinces receiving US$150 000 to support short-term projects for war veterans.

President Mnangagwa also launched a US$2 million revolving fund aimed at supporting youth-led income-generating projects countrywide.

Each province will receive US$200 000.

news.title: Four Chitungwiza men in court over vehicle arson attacks
news.content:
Prosper Dembedza

Four Chitungwiza men have appeared in court for allegedly carrying out a series of vehicle arson attacks at business premises in Avondale, Highlands, Newlands and Goromonzi on Friday last week.

Last Matarutse (40), Abel Jobe (47), Kizito Chinhanga (40) and Thomas Chanetsa (45) were charged with malicious damage to property when they appeared separately before Harare magistrate, Ms Marehwanazvo Gofa.

The court remanded them in custody to April 14, advising them to apply for bail at the High Court.

Allegations are that Matarutse targeted IMC Communications at 42 Lanark Road, Avondale.

He is accused of driving his silver Toyota Corolla to the premises and setting the vehicle on fire at the entrance gate, causing damage to the lighting system and a Starlink authorised dealer signpost.

Jobe is accused of attempting to destroy Sano Complex in Goromonzi after he reportedly drove his blue Nissan Sunny to the premises and set the vehicle on fire. However, the fire did not cause any significant damage.

Chinhanga is being charged with targeting Sakunda Holdings at 11 Argyle Road, Avondale.

He allegedly drove his blue Nissan X-Trail to the entrance, set the vehicle on fire, and attempted to destroy the premises.

Chanetsa allegedly attempted to burn down a DA Service Station at 486A Glenara Avenue, North Highlands in Harare.

He is accused of driving his red Toyota Raum to the forecourt and setting it on fire. The blaze was extinguished before it could cause any damage.
news.description: Four Chitungwiza men have appeared in court for allegedly carrying out a series of vehicle arson attacks at business premises in Avondale, Highlands, Newlands and Goromonzi on Friday last week.

news.title: Buhera woman scalds hubby with hot water over scotch cart dispute
news.content:
Online Reporter

A man from Majere Village in Buhera is battling for his life at Victoria Chitepo Hospital in Mutare after his wife scalded him with hot water following a heated dispute over the use of their scotch cart.

Mr Munyaradzi Muchetu, who was initially admitted at Murambinda Hospital before being transferred to Manicaland Provinces biggest referral hospital, sustained severe burns after his wife, Estery Gwenzi (34), scalded him.

The incident occurred on March 29 at their homestead.

Gwenzi has since been taken to Buhera Magistrates Court and is facing charges of attempted murder.

Gwenzi was not asked to plead to the charges when she appeared before magistrate Mr Poterai Gwezhira.

She was remanded in custody and will appear at Rusape Regional Court on April 4.

According to the State, Mr Muchetus sister, Ms Simbiso Muchetu, returned the couples scotch cart to their homestead.

The couple exchanged words until they decided to call Ms Muchetu to resolve the matter.

The court heard that moments after Ms Muchetu left the couples place, Gwenzi fetched a bucket with hot water and poured it on her husband.
news.description: A man from Majere Village in Buhera is battling for his life at Victoria Chitepo Hospital in Mutare after his wife scalded him with hot water following a heated dispute over the use of their scotch cart.

news.title: Vendors protest over uncollected garbage at Mbare Vegetable Market
news.content:
Diana Nherera

Vendors at Mbare Vegetable Wholesale Market are refusing to pay fees to the Harare City Council as garbage has not been collected over the past four months.

Ward 3 Councillor Simbarashe Chanachimwe revealed this during last weeks council meeting.

He said that there was rotten garbage at the market.

The only way to restore the markets reputation and functionality is through a comprehensive daily refuse collection strategy, he emphasised. People need gumboots to walk in the market.

Councillor Chanachimwe said new dumpsites are emerging in Mbare.

Harare Mayor Jacob Mafume said affected areas need to be identified.

Lets improve it and ensure regular collection, he said.

We need to ensure that the garbage goes where its supposed to go.
news.description: Vendors at Mbare Vegetable Wholesale Market are refusing to pay fees to the Harare City Council as garbage has not been collected over the past four months.

news.title: President hands over US$7,4 million farm equipment to youths
news.content:
Online Reporters

In a move that seeks to empower young people in agriculture, President Mnangagwa has handed over 72 high-tech tractors and 10 combine harvesters valued at US$7,4 million to youth agricultural groups from various provinces.

The official handover ceremony, held at the Agricultural Mechanisation Facility in Hatcliffetoda, is a follow-up to the Presidential Youth Empowerment Scheme that was recently launched, with the President pledging to pay 50 percent of the total cost of the equipment.

The event also saw each province receiving a borehole-drilling rig to accelerate the establishment of irrigation systems in Youth Business Units.

The Government is buying the agricultural equipment from Belarus to resell to farmers under flexible financing terms through Empower Bank.

The terms include a three-year repayment period with no collateral required and an interest rate of just 7,5 percent per annum.
news.description: In a move that seeks to empower young people in agriculture, President Mnangagwa has handed over 72 high-tech tractors and 10 combine harvesters valued at US$7,4 million to youth agricultural groups from various provinces.

news.title: Firm stopped from mining in Makonde
news.content:
Nyore Madzianike

THE High Court has ordered Angel Hill Mining Private Limited, a Chinese mining company, to immediately halt its mining and desilting activities along Angwa River in Makonde District, Mashonaland West Province.

The ruling was made as the company failed to obtain an Environmental Impact Assessment (EIA) certificate from the Environmental Management Agency (EMA).

High Court judge, Justice Tawanda Chitapi, has set conditions for the mining company to resume its activities.

He ruled that the company can only resume its operations after it has obtained the EIA certificate and approval from EMA to mine in the area.

In his application, the EMA director general argued that the Chinese company was operating illegally and should cease its activities until it gets authorisation.

In his ruling, Justice Chitapi emphasised the legal requirement for an EIA certificate.

In my view, the applicant was entitled to the interdict he seeks because, as it stands, the respondents operations are being conducted outside the law, Justice Chitapi stated.

The court cannot permit the continuation of an illegality if it has been established.
news.description: THE High Court has ordered Angel Hill Mining Private Limited, a Chinese mining company, to immediately halt its mining and desilting activities along Angwa River in Makonde District, Mashonaland West Province.

news.title: 13 companies honoured at Chitungwiza Trade Fair
news.content:
Diana Nherera

OLD Mutual and Nyaradzo Life Assurance Company emerged as standout exhibitors at the Chitungwiza Trade Fair, earning top honours for Best Financial Advisor and Best Funeral Provider, respectively.

Young Africa was recognised for Best Educational Stand, while Kunaka won Best SME in Chitungwiza. Probfix Financial Services took home the award for Best Microfinance Institution.

Other winners included Croc Security for Best Security Stand, Knock Out for Best Home Use Product, and Azam TV for Best Home Entertainment Exhibitor.

Florida Engineering was named Best Renewable Energy Exhibitor, Bethel Events won Best Events Exhibitor, and Telecel claimed the title of Best Telecom Network Operator.

Utsanzi was recognised as Best Newcomer, while Zimra secured the award for Best Government Agency Stand.

Speaking at the awards ceremony at Chitungwiza Town Centre last week, Chitungwiza Trade Fair executive Mr Lexie Mrewa praised the exhibitors for their contributions to the local economy.

Let us continue to expand our reach and attract more customers. While Chitungwizas official population is 400 000, the Chitungwiza Publicity Association estimates it could be as high as 1.5 million. If you attract even five percent of that, you have a strong customer base to sustain your business, he said.

Mr Mrewa said Chitungwiza is a dynamic hub of talent and opportunity.

Chitungwiza is a source of markets, talent, and innovation. Some of Zimbabwes largest churches and most celebrated musicians started here. While there are challenges, there is also immense potential. I urge you to see Chitungwiza as a powerful economic force, he said.
news.description: OLD Mutual and Nyaradzo Life Assurance Company emerged as standout exhibitors at the Chitungwiza Trade Fair, earning top honours for Best Financial Advisor and Best Funeral Provider, respectively.

news.title: Vee Mampeezy plans solo show in Bulawayo
news.content:
Langalakhe Mabena

Zimpapers Arts and Entertainment Hub

BOTSWANA music star Vee Mampeezy, famed for his hit song Taku Taku, has announced plans for a solo concert in Bulawayo following the overwhelming support he received at the SWAN Music Festival this past weekend.

The festival, held at White City Stadium, saw Mampeezy share the stage with top artistes, including Alick Macheso, Awa Khiwe, Winky D, Kwesta, and Toss.

Reflecting on his deep connection with Bulawayo, Mampeezy, born Odirile Ishmael Sento, revealed that the city was the first in Zimbabwe to embrace him when he performed there two decades ago.

I was amazed by the love and energy at White City Stadium. The crowd knew almost every song, and it was emotional to see that Bulawayo still supports me after all these years, he said.

My first international gig outside Botswana was here in Bulawayo, and the support has never wavered. To show my gratitude, I want to host a solo concert to celebrate this bond.

The musician expressed his love for Zimbabwe, adding that he is eager to collaborate with local promoters to make the event a reality.

Mampeezy launched his music career at 16, releasing his debut album Kasi Angels in 2001, which became an instant hit.

His signature blend of kwaito, gospel, and house music has earned him a loyal fan base across Africa.

He cites legendary figures like the late Brenda Fassie, Hugh Masekela, and Oliver Mtukudzi as key influences.

Mampeezy has collaborated with several top African artistes, including the late kwaito icon Mandoza and Nigerian dancehall star Patoranking.
news.description: BOTSWANA music star Vee Mampeezy, famed for his hit song "Taku Taku", has announced plans for a solo concert in Bulawayo following the overwhelming support he received at the SWAN Music Festival this past weekend.

news.title: Jasen Mphepo challenges comedians to support each other
news.content:
Trust Khosa

Zimpapers Arts and Entertainment Hub

VETERAN theatre practitioner Jasen Mphepo has challenged stand-up comedians to foster a culture of mutual support by attending each others shows.

Mphepo, who hosts various shows at the Jasen Mphepo Little Theatre in Harare, said many established comedians do not support emerging talent.

I have observed a troubling trend where seasoned comedians rarely attend shows featuring upcoming performers. They dont show up to cheer them on, he said.

He contrasted this with the music industry, where established artists routinely support their peers.

Musicians have created a positive tradition of attending each others performances, especially during family shows. Prominent figures like producer Clive Mono Mukundu often show up, celebrate peers.

Mphepo said unity among comedians is crucial for the industrys growth.

In the spirit of camaraderie and professionalism, we expect comedians to uplift each other by attending shows. Their presence alone can elevate a young performers event, he noted.

If comedians dont support each other, fans wont take them seriously. Collaboration is essential for growth and strengthening the entertainment landscape.

Mphepo has long championed young talent at his theatre, recently hosting rising comedy stars such as Josh Mukahanana, Mike Chipere, Munya Guramatunhu, David Chimusoro, and Tinotenda Kurwaisimba.

By promoting mutual support, he hopes to cultivate a thriving comedy industry.
news.description: VETERAN theatre practitioner Jasen Mphepo has challenged stand-up comedians to foster a culture of mutual support by attending each other’s shows.

news.title: Macheso, Soma pre-Independence bash on cards
news.content:
Trust Khosa

Zimpapers Arts and Entertainment Hub

As the build-up to the 45th Uhuru Celebrations gathers momentum, sungura musicians Alick Macheso and Somandla Mafia Ndebele are eager to deliver an unforgettable experience for their fans.

This dynamic duo, known for their electrifying performances, will once again take to the stage together on April 11 for a pre-Independence bash at Warras Park in Glen View, Harare.

In a recent interview, representatives from Machesos camp expressed their enthusiasm for the upcoming event.

We are already immersed in the spirit of celebrating Independence Day, remarked Tichaona Makahamadze, Machesos publicist.

On the 11th of April, we will undoubtedly usher in the Independence mood with a spectacular double act alongside Somandla Ndebele. Our series of joint shows has been overwhelmingly well-received, and fans have truly embraced this collaboration.

We cant wait for the big day and encourage everyone to come out in their large numbers to enjoy the festivities.

Makahamadze urged Zimbabweans to take pride in their heritage during this significant month.

April holds a special place in our hearts as we celebrate Independence Day. Its the perfect time for us all to reflect on who we are and honour the sacrifices made by our freedom fighters, he added.

Ndebele said their joint show will be a special occasion.

I am proud to be Zimbabwean, and I cant wait to celebrate this day with my fellow citizens. Our pre-Independence Day gig on April 11 alongside my brother Alick Macheso will be a special occasion. We are committed to giving our fans a memorable treat, he said.
news.description: As the build-up to the 45th Uhuru Celebrations gathers momentum, sungura musicians Alick Macheso and Somandla “Mafia” Ndebele are eager to deliver an unforgettable experience for their fans.
